name: D. Eating
statement:
There are n slimes on a line, the i-th of which has weight w_i. Slime i
is able to eat another slime j if w_i
geq w_j; afterwards, slime j disappears and the weight of slime i
becomes w_i
oplus w_j^{
text{ }}.The King of Slimes wants to run an x as follows: Add a new
slime with weight x to the right end of the line (after the n-th slime).
This new slime eats the slime to its left if it is able to, and then
takes its place (moves one place to the left). It will continue to do
this until there is either no slime to its left or the weight of the
slime to its left is greater than its own weight. (No other slimes are
eaten during this process.) The of this experiment is the total number
of slimes eaten. The King of Slimes is going to ask you q queries. In
each query, you will be given an integer x, and you need to determine
the score of the experiment with parameter x.Note that the King does not
want you to actually perform each experiment; his slimes would die,
which is not ideal. He is only asking what the hypothetical score is; in
other words, the queries are persistent.^{
text{ }}Here
oplus denotes the bitwise XOR operation.
